name: From Book to Map to Video Game: Texts and their Digital Transformations
description: An examination of the new forms of storytelling made possible by digital media from two perspectives, that of the maker and that of the scholarly reader. Students learn to critically analyze storytelling in new media and experiment with their own adaptations of a literary text to various digital platforms.
prerequisites: WDW235H1 and WDW236H1; open to students not taking the Digital Humanities Minor by permission of the program coordinator.
